body:
I might be doing something wrong but I cannot reproduce this issue on Windows 8 with the latest master from Libgdx.

Sanity check, are you sure you're not leaving the `V` key pressed after you release `Ctrl`? It shouldn't trigger the repeat key but still.
Yeah, I am absolutely sure. It works like this: press command, press v, clipboard content and v appear immediately, release v, release command.
I can reproduce on OS X Yosemite.

I think it might be OS X specific, but that is only speculation. Would be nice if someone could try and reproduce it on OS X.

On the other hand, I figured that the copy and paste actions are handled in the keyDown method of TextFieldClickListener and the text insertion is handled in keyTyped. However, nothing in keyTyped cancels the insertion if command / control is pressed.

@saltares: Could you add the following line as the first line to the keyTyped method in TextFieldClickListener and see what it prints?

```
System.out.printf("typed '%c'%n", character);
```

For me it prints:

```
typed '' // command pressed
typed 'v' // v pressed
```

Also, for me, pasting seems to stop working correctly after the first paste. Afterwards, it takes several tries and very quick timing on the Command and V pressed to get it to work (they have to have been pressed nearly at the same time).

I added `if (UIUtils.ctrl()) return false;` on my end and it works, not sure if it affects things on the other platforms.

It doesn't fix the fact that pasting really only works correctly the first time though... But That seems like the key events are not even being delivered so wouldn't be a libgdx issue.
If you check for `isMac` explicitly it won't affect other platforms. The condition that I've posted is just the part of the `UIUtils.ctrl()` method that handles OS X.
Yeah, but I guess I have to wonder... under what conditions would you actually want to append text while Ctrl (or Command) is pressed?

This does only happen if you use the lwjgl test starter. It works fine on mac using the jglfw test starter...

Edit: Using the jglfw test starter I cannot enter any text while pressing control! With lwjgl I can enter normal letters (b, d, e, f, g, ...) while pressing control.

I've also found this issue on OSX Yosemite. It also happens with <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>A</kbd> to select everything (so it selects everything, then it types an `A`, so you get a field with only an `A` on it).

Also, and maybe related to what @MobiDevelop comments about it not working properly after a while, sometimes just pressing <kbd>A</kbd> clears the whole textfield and adds an `A` there, without me pressing <kbd>Cmd</kbd>

issue.title: Fix #3340. TextField ignores input on mac if command is pressed.
issue.body: This fixes cut, copy, paste and select-all keyboard shortcuts not working on mac as discussed in issue #3340.

issue.title: TextField issue

labels.name: need more info
labels.description: needs more info. Likely to be closed when no reaction given.

issue.body: in the method #paste, if writeEnters is false and c is \n, c won't be filtered out.
